summary: An internal FBI email from July 2, 2019, sent shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's indictment in SDNY, outlining urgent operational plans for his arrest upon return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, and deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FRI New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating the urgent operational response to Epstein's indictment and planning arrest, search, and interview activities.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and an arrest warrant was issued.

events.title: Urgent FBI Operational Planning
events.description: FBI squad C-20 initiates urgent planning for Epstein's arrest upon U.S. return, execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, and deployment to Florida for subpoenas and interviews.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking FRI New York

locations: NYC (New York City, specifically Epstein's residence)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, and an arrest warrant was issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI planned to execute a search warrant at Epstein's residence in New York City.
The FBI also planned to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals.
The operational planning was urgent and required coordination of the entire squad, with assistance from A4 and the branch, due to uncertainty about Epstein's return timeline.
